text:
@jcreedy @RobGMacfarlane @EnvAgency Looking at the way they have built up the river bank, presumably DIY flood prevention? Reaction to this record breaking flood on the Lugg in Kingsland area In Feb 2020.
https://t.co/97QehMdJvh

@DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Did you know about this on 26th November as reported by the Guardian? In which case why has it taken 9 days to act in he face of such devastation?
RT @EnvAgency: We're mounting a wide-ranging investigation into reports of damage to the #RiverLugg, which is protected through SSSI status‚Ä¶

RT @RobGMacfarlane: A mile of the River Lugg has been bulldozed to destruction.
Bankside trees grubbed out & burnt.
Riverbed scraped out.
M‚Ä¶

@FreyaLouisa @TheMichaelMoran @RobGMacfarlane @EnvAgency Yep, almost certainly an expensive DIY flood prevention scheme, after the Lugg saw record flood levels in Feb 2020. Perhaps they suffered some losses (flooded land or property) and just went for it?

@TheMichaelMoran @RobGMacfarlane @FreyaLouisa @EnvAgency The River Lugg reached its highest level on record on 16th Feb this year, with video footage of much of the adjacent land through the area in question under flood water. This work must be an expensive, damaging and illegal attempt at preventing future flooding of their land!

RT @CraigBennett3: BEFORE & AFTER

Appalling #EcoVandalism at The #RiverLugg SSSI #Herefordshire

THIS IS ILLEGAL ACTIVITY

So it's a CRITI‚Ä¶
RT @NaturalEngland: We're taking reports of environmental damage to the #SSSI at the #RiverLugg very seriously, and are working with @EnvAg‚Ä¶

@DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil So come on EA, tell us when you were first alerted, and why it has taken this long to take action? You are at work and it is an outdoors activity, so please don‚Äôt patronise us with COVID. Looking at thread, this looks even more inept than NRW with the Lynfi pollution.
@EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm Ea slow off the mark again

@MailMair @CountryfileMag @LeeEvansWales @GlassJet @EnvAgency @WildlifeTrusts There was some flooding in February and I suspect the locals would just have presumed this was being carried out by the IDB with all the EA permits in place ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èclearly proves we need more proactive & keep a watch on riverside landowners

entity.name: Countryfile
entity.description: Stories are shared of the people, places and issues at the heart of the British countryside. Popular features include the programme's photography contest, which culminates in a yearly calendar sold to benefit charity, the Video Diary, produced by viewers and focused on life in rural areas, and the weather forecasts.
